Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Israel's Mossad planted explosives in Hezbollah's pagers 5 months ago: ReportsIsrael's Mossad planted explosives inside 5,000 Taiwan-made pagers ordered by Hezbollah, months ahead of the mass detonations across Lebanon that killed nine people and injured nearly 3,000 on Tuesday.

9 killed, 2,750 injured in Lebanon pager blasts, Hezbollah vows to punish Israel  Live Updates According to Reuters, a Hezbollah official said the detonation of the pagers was the "biggest security breach" the group had been subjected to in nearly a year of war with Israel.

Donald Trump says he will meet PM Modi next week during his US visit Donald Trump announced at a Michigan campaign event that he will meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi next week during Modi's visit to the United States.

Image of Titan sub, chilling 3-word message before implosion revealedThe first photo of the Titan sub, which suffered a catastrophic implosion last year, killing five people onboard, was released during a public hearing. Pagers: Lebanon blasts targeting Hezbollah bring vintage devices into focusPagers, widely used in the 20th century, operated by transmitting and receiving radio signals. Their distinctive features, along with privacy and security, made them a preferred communication mode among Hezbollah militants.

Moment Hezbollah members' pagers exploded at grocery store in LebanonIn a grocery store in Lebanon, Hezbollah members were injured when the pagers they used to communicate exploded.  Over 1,000 individuals, including Hezbollah fighters and medics, were injured across Lebanon.

US denies any involvement in Lebanon pager blasts, Hezbollah blames IsraelPagers used by hundreds of members of the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah for communication exploded almost simultaneously on Tuesday, killing at least nine people, including an 8-year-old girl, and injuring several thousand. The Iran-backed militants, who have been in armed conflict with Israel since the October 7 Hamas attack, blamed Israel for what appeared to be a sophisticated remote attack. Following the development, tensions soared once again in the region, which has been simmering for many months. Stay tuned to India Today as we bring you the latest updates on the Hezbollah pager blasts in Lebanon.

100 days of Modi 3.0 vs Modi 2.0: Why C is for contrastAs Modi 3.0 marks its first 100 days with a blend of bold moves and strategic retreats, the contrast with the sweeping reforms of Modi 2.0 is clearly visible.
